thread.title: Lady Cougars crush Newton in mercy-rule win
thread.title_full: Lady Cougars crush Newton in mercy-rule win

title: Lady Cougars crush Newton in mercy-rule win
text:
Comments 
COVINGTON — If the Newnan Lady Cougars softball team had any doubts about opening the Class state tournament on the road Wednesday against Newton, they were quickly laid to rest. 
Using a potent offense, Newnan rolled to a sweep of the host Lady Rams 14-0 and 12-4 in games called by the mercy rule. 
The Lady Cougars outhit the Lady Rams 25-9 while returning to the GHSA Class Sweet 16. 
Newnan went into the contest as the No. 3 seed out of Region 3- after losing to both East Coweta and South Cobb last week in the region tournament, and will now travel to South Forsyth for the second-round game. 
South Forsyth swept Peachtree Ridge in its first round. 
The winner advances to Columbus and the Elite 8. 
Newnan pitcher Addie Andrews picked up the win in both games, combining for eight strikeouts, one walk and five hits. 
Newnan set the table in the first game with six runs in the first three innings. The Lady Cougars kept the offense going with two more runs in the fourth, and put the game away with an six-run offensive explosion in the fifth. 
Leslie Davis paced the Lady Cougars to the victory in the first game, finishing 2-for-4 with three RBIs. Katelin Richardson was 3-for-3 with two RBIs, including a triple. 
Davis finished the first game with two doubles and Sarah Vallery also added a double. 
Danielle Curlee helped spark the Lady Cougars’ offense from the bottom of the order in the first game, finishing with two hits. 
Little changed for Newnan in the nightcap. With the Lady Rams batting first in the second contest, Newnan gave up a run in the top of the first, but regained the lead for good when it pushed three runs across the plate in the bottom of the first. 
From there, it scored at least one run in every inning, including two in the second, five in the third, and one each in the fourth and fifth. 
The Lady Rams managed to push one more run across in the second and two in the fifth before the Lady Cougars put and end to the Lady Rams’ season. 
Leadoff hitter Hannah Scarbrough led the offense with a 2-for-4 performance in the second game and scored three times. 
Vallery continued to swing a potent bat in the second game, with two RBIs. First baseman Maysen Willard also drove in a pair of runs. 
Darby Keene and Curlee also had an RBI. 
GAME 1 
Lady Cougars 14, Lady Rams 0 
Newnan 024 26—14 16 2 
Newton 000 00—0 2 5 
WP — Addie Andrews 
Lady Cougars 12, Lady Rams 4 
Newton 110002 — 4 3 2 
Newnan 32511x—1293
